name: Observed variable – measurand
definition: Variable intended to be measured, observed or derived, including the biogeophysical context

name: Measurement unit
definition: Real scalar quantity, defined and adopted by convention, with which any other quantity of the same kind can be compared to express the ratio of the two quantities as a number (JCGM, 2012; reference no. 1.9)

name: Temporal extent
definition: Time period covered by a series of observations inclusive of the specified date/time indications (measurement history)

name: Spatial extent
definition: Typical spatial georeferenced volume covered by the observations

name: Representativeness
definition: Spatial extent of the region around the observation of which it is representative

name: Application area(s)
definition: Context within, or intended application(s) for which the observation is primarily made or which has/have the most stringent requirements

name: Programme/ network affiliation
definition: The global, regional or national programme(s)/ network(s) that the station/platform is associated with

name: Region of origin of data
definition: WMO Region

name: Territory of origin of data
definition: Country or territory name of the location of the observation

name: Station/ platform name
definition: Official name of the station/ platform

name: Station/ platform type
definition: A categorization of the type of observing facility at which an observation is made

name: Station/ platform unique identifier
definition: The WIGOS station identifier, which is a globally unique and consistent identifier for an observing facility (station/ platform)

name: Geospatial location
definition: Position in space defining the location of the observing station/platform at the time of observation

name: Data communication method
definition: Data communication method between the station/platform and some central facility

name: Station operating status
definition: Declared reporting status of the station

name: Station/ platform cluster
definition: Indicates that a station/ platform is part of a grouping of stations/ platforms, which is identified by a name and a description

name: Surface cover
definition: The observed (bio)physical cover on the Earth’s surface in the vicinity of the observation

name: Surface cover classification scheme
definition: Name and reference or link to document describing the classification scheme

name: Topography or bathymetry
definition: The shape or configuration of a geographical feature, represented on a map by contour lines

name: Events at observing facility
definition: Description of human action or natural event at the facility or in the vicinity that may influence the observation

name: Site information
definition: Non-formalized information about the location and surroundings at which an observation is made and that may influence it

name: Surface roughness
definition: Terrain classification in terms of aerodynamic roughness length

name: Climate zone
definition: The Köppen climate classification of the region where the observing facility is located

name: Source of observation
definition: The source of the dataset described by the metadata

name: Measurement/ observing method
definition: The method of measurement/ observation used

name: Instrument specifications
definition: Intrinsic capability of the measurement/observing method to measure the designated element, including range, stability, precision, etc.

name: Instrument operating status
definition: The status of an instrument with respect to its operation

name: Vertical distance of sensor
definition: Vertical distance of the sensor from a (specified) reference level, such as local ground, deck of a marine platform at the point where the sensor is located, or sea surface

name: Configuration of instrumentation
definition: Description of any shielding or configuration/setup of the instrumentation or auxiliary equipment needed to make the observation or to reduce the impact of extraneous influences on the observation

name: Instrument control schedule
definition: Description of schedule for calibrations or verification of instrument

name: Instrument control result
definition: The result of an instrument control check, including date, time, location, standard type and period of validity

name: Instrument model and serial number
definition: Details of manufacturer, model number, serial number and firmware version if applicable

name: Instrument routine maintenance
definition: A description of maintenance that is routinely performed on an instrument

name: Maintenance party
definition: Identifier of the organization or individual who performed the maintenance activity

name: Geospatial location
definition: Geospatial location of instrument/sensor

name: Maintenance activity
definition: Description of maintenance performed on instrument

name: Status of observation
definition: Official status of observation

name: Exposure of instruments
definition: The degree to which an instrument is affected by external influences and reflects the value of the observed variable

name: Sampling procedures
definition: Procedures involved in obtaining a sample

name: Sample treatment
definition: Chemical or physical treatment of sample prior to analysis

name: Sampling strategy
definition: The strategy used to generate the observed variable

name: Sampling time period
definition: The period of time over which a measurement is taken

name: Spatial sampling resolution
definition: Spatial resolution refers to the size of the smallest observable object. The intrinsic resolution of an imaging system is determined primarily by the instantaneous field of view of the sensor, which is a measure of the ground area viewed by a single detector element in a given instance in time.

name: Temporal sampling interval
definition: Time period between the beginning of consecutive sampling periods

name: Diurnal base time
definition: Time to which diurnal statistics are referenced

name: Schedule of observation
definition: Schedule of observation

name: Data- processing methods and algorithms
definition: A description of the processing used to generate the observation and list of algorithms utilized to derive the resultant value

name: Processing/ analysis centre
definition: Centre at which the observation is processed.

name: Temporal reporting period
definition: Time period over which the observed variable is reported

name: Spatial reporting interval
definition: Spatial interval at which the observed variable is reported

name: Software/ processor and version
definition: Name and version of the software or processor utilized to derive the element value

name: Level of data
definition: Level of data processing

name: Data format1
definition: Description of the format in which the observed variable is being provided

name: Version of data format1
definition: Version of the data format in which the observed variable is being provided

name: Aggregation period
definition: Time period over which individual samples/ observations are aggregated

name: Reference time
definition: Time base to which date and time stamps refer

name: Reference datum
definition: Reference datum used to convert observed quantity to reported quantity

name: Numerical resolution
definition: Measure of the detail in which a numerical quantity is expressed

name: Timeliness (of reporting)
definition: The typical time between completion of the observation or collection of the datum and when the datum is reported

name: Schedule of international exchange
definition: Allows distinction if/ when observations are made/not made available internationally

name: Uncertainty of measurement
definition: Non-negative parameter, associated with the result of a measurement, that characterizes the dispersion of the values that could reasonably be attributed to the observation/measurand

name: Procedure used to estimate uncertainty
definition: A reference or link pointing to a document describing the procedures/algorithms used to derive the uncertainty statement

name: Quality flag
definition: An ordered list of qualifiers indicating the result of a quality control process applied to the observation

name: Quality flagging system
definition: Reference to the system used to flag the quality of the observation

name: Traceability
definition: Statement defining traceability to a standard, including sequence of measurement standards and calibrations that is used to relate a measurement result to a reference (JCGM, 2012; reference no. 2.42)

name: Supervising organization
definition: Name of organization who owns the observation

name: Data policy/use constraints
definition: Details relating to the use and limitations surrounding data imposed by the supervising organization

name: Contact (nominated focal point)
definition: Principal contact (nominated focal point) for resource
